product_name: CliniqueTake The Day Off Charcoal Cleansing Balm Makeup Remover
summary: SummaryHighlightsSustainable PackagingClinique Take The Day Off Charcoal Cleansing Balm Makeup Remover dissolves eye and face makeups, and sunscreens. Now with detoxifying Japanese charcoal.
details: DetailsBenefitsSkin Types: Dry Combination, Combination Oily, Oily.Clinique's #1 makeup remover, now with Japanese charcoal to detoxify and remove excess oil.Unclogs pores, helping clear dirt, oil, pollution, and other impurities.Quickly dissolves tenacious eye and face makeups, sunscreens.Transforms from a solid balm into a silky oil upon application.Rinses off completely - without leaving an oily residue behind.Key IngredientsJapanese charcoal: This purifying ingredient helps deeply cleanse and detoxifies pores.Safflower seed oil: Works efficiently to help break up natural oil found on skin, plus dissolves hard-to-remove makeup.Rich in linoleic acid, this natural emollient helps leave skin feeling soft and nourished.Research ResultsOver 95% removal of face makeup, sunscreen, and pollutants.**Average removal of longwearing foundation, hybrid sunscreen, and carbon powder.Item 2604463How To UseUse dry fingertips to massage balm over dry skin.Rinse well with warm water. Pat dry.IngredientsEthylhexyl Palmitate, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Sorbeth-30 Tetraoleate, Synthetic Wax, PEG-5 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Charcoal Powder, Tocopherol, Caprylyl Glycol, Water\Aqua\Eau, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Phenoxyethanol.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use dry fingertips to massage balm over dry skin.Rinse well with warm water. Pat dry.

reviews.headline: Get the original
reviews.comments: This works just as great as the original Take The Day Off. However, I thought the smell was terrible. I personally couldn't get past it. I would just buy the original.

reviews.headline: Good product, terrible smell
reviews.comments: I mean, the product works, but its slightly sticky and it smells like Play-Doh. Not a fan.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: I love this cleansing balm. It works so well at removing makeup. My face is clean and feels great. As far as the charcoal part that some are complaining about, I have had no issues with stains. I actually like tje fact that the black/grey is easy to spot in my sink and rinses away so easily.

reviews.headline: Works well, but messy.
reviews.comments:
I tried this because I love the regular Take Off the Day balm. I have oily skin, and the regular actually seemed to help it, so I thought the charcoal version would be amazing. 
It does leave a film on the face, as did the original, but my toner took care of that. The charcoal version is so messy and will get all over anything it touches, or drips on when rinsing off. I decided to only use it in the shower because of this.
All that being said, my skin is happy with it, but I'll probably switch back to the original version.

reviews.headline: Wow!
reviews.comments: I'm utterly amazed how good this Take the day off charcoal balm works!!! I can have full face makeup on and this balm gently removes it all!!! I have oily to dry skin (and sometimes sensitive) and I had no irritations whatsoever! I'll forever be a repeat customer for this product!

reviews.headline: Won't buy again
reviews.comments: I've used Clinique for over 30 years. Always love the products. However I don't like this make up remover balm. Way too greasy for my already oily skin. Feels like crisco on my face. And it smells terrible, like old used cooking oil.

reviews.headline: Good
reviews.comments: I really love these balm it takes off my whole full face makeup. I really recommend this product.

reviews.headline: Better options
reviews.comments: This product is very greasy and messy. It does clean, but there are so many other better cleansers that Clinique makes. I would not buy this again.

reviews.headline: This product is great...if you like giant messes
reviews.comments:
I only gave this product 2 stars because it does technically remove makeup like it claims to. But everything else about it is absolutely awful. No matter how careful I am when using it, I always end up with black hair, black hands, black countertops, a black sink, a black towel. This product makes a HUGE mess and stains literally everything. It smells weird. And the charcoal doesn't actually do anything it claims to, so there's no point for it to even be in the product. I would easily put this on a list of my top 3 least favorite products of all time. 

The original Clinique cleansing balm without the charcoal is great though! Go for that one instead.

reviews.headline: Love!
reviews.comments: Clinique is THAT girl!

reviews.headline: Clinique charcoal Cleansing Balm
reviews.comments: Amazing! Removes makeup well and isn't too greasy.

reviews.headline: I would purchase this product again.
reviews.comments: Great product to remove makeup.

reviews.headline: A break up
reviews.comments:
I've been using this product for over a year and it has been fantastic. I have oily skin and this is the only balm I've found that works for me. 
I bought a new one a week ago and its not the same! I knew it was different the second I rubbed my hands together. It's really oily and very difficult to wash off completely.  I used it every day to see how it affected my skin. Unfortunately it made me breakout terribly. Maybe I got a bad one? ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
I will be returning it and I wont risk repurchasing in hopes it was a bad batch. Back to the drawing boardüòû

reviews.headline: Good cleaning effect, horrible smell
reviews.comments: I got this product as a sample. I have had good experiences with Clinique products in the past and in regards to how well it cleans off my makeup, it works well  and it isn't drying. However, the product has this strong, awful rancid cooking oil smell.

reviews.headline: Works but burns eyes
reviews.comments: It works at removing makeup like foundation and mascara but my eyes burned for hours after using and washing off. Won't be using again.

reviews.headline: Like it
reviews.comments: I realize it's black in color and can't "see" that all the makeup is taken off (this was recommended to me because I have combo skin) but it doesn't leave a greasy residue on my skin after cleansing it and my skin doesn't feel stripped.

reviews.headline: Surprised and satisfied
reviews.comments: I recieved the sample Charcoal 'Take the day off' cleansing balm and I honestly didn't expect to like it because the regular one didnt work for my skin and (now as a 36 yr old) most things make my face feel dry‚Äî even when it advertises that it wont. I am so happy I got to try the charcoal version because it's exactly what I've been looking for. This product doesnt make my face dry at all, and its effective AND gentle. I love it and I highly recommend!

reviews.headline: Gentle yet effective!
reviews.comments: I purchased the large origional clear pomade of this brand along with other Clinique products which got me decent size samples including the newest "charcoal" pomade. Since I have both, there's not much difference I can tell you between the two. They both work the same, eitherway the product works great and still very gentle on eyes while still removing all the built up makeup breaking it up easy while dry. The only bad thing I'd say is this that this is NOT your one stop remover and will absolutely need to follow up with their cleanser or you will breakout because it breaks down but it won't clear and wash it all off. Its fine, and I personally like this system leaving me squeaky clean.

reviews.headline: The best cleaning balm!
reviews.comments: This is a great cleansing balm, the bad reviews I keep seeing are of people wiping it off their face. first of all this balm should be applied to the face then should begin to activate with water which turns it into a milky consistency as it begins to remove all traces of makeup. You should then follow up with a gel based cleanser. Your skin should be left feeling clean this way, hope this helps!

reviews.headline: Meh.
reviews.comments: I wanted to like this product but it just didn't seem to work well with removing the eye makeup.

media.headline: Good for taking off foundations and basic face products
Good for taking off foundations and basic face products
If you're a fan of the original, you'll like this too
LOVE this for a deep clean!
Not oily

media.headline: Great cleansing balm that takes off my heavy make up
media.caption: Great cleansing balm for heavy make up

faceoff_positive.comments: I tried the Clinique Take the Day Off Charcoal Cleansing Balm. It claims to quickly dissolve long wearing eye and face makeup. It also claims to help detoxify, reduce excess oils, and unclog pores. You simply use your fingertips to massage on dry skina¬π, then simply rinse off with warm water. It also claims to leave skin clean without leaving behind an oily or greasy residue. First off, I have to say I'm obsessed with a good cleansing balm. It's really my preferred formula for removing makeup at the end of the day. It's very important to me that the balm doesn't burn my eyes, removes everything effectively,  and doesn't leave behind oily or greasy residue. I found this clinique black charcoal balm to be amazing. The balm itself has such a silky feel. It glides across the skin flawlessly, and it breaks down the makeup easily. It doesn't burn my eyes, and I haven't had any sort of reaction from the balm. It washes away easily, and it doesn't leave any sort of unwanted residue or skin troubles behind. I've used various mascara formulas to be removed by this balm, and they all broke down quickly, effortlessly, and painlessly with this balm. Honestly, this is the first charcoal cleansing balm I've tried, and I absolutely love it! I've tried a lot of cleansing balms over the years, and I would have to put Clinique Charcoal Cleansing Balm in my top 3, without a doubt. It's obvious with how easily it breaks down and removes makeup without irritation, balm itself feels silky to touch, and it doesn't leave behind greasy residue. The balm delivered on all claims for me, and I highly recommend giving it a try. I will absolutely buy this cleansing balm again. If you love a high quality balm, then Clinique Black Charcoal is worth picking up and trying! I love the added ingredients of Japanese Charcoal to detoxify, while removing makeup and impurities. As I previously said, this is my first time trying a Charcoal balm, and I am quite certain I like it better than the original formula, as well as the liquid! This balm is such a wonderful product!
faceoff_positive.headline: Powerful Cleansing Balm

faceoff_negative.comments: I personally do not really like this cleanser, it does it's job but it almost like there's a learning curve lol. It works but it feels messy. First off I don't like that the balm goes on pigmented and makes it look like your mascara is smudged lol it's very off putting and you have to reapply it a few times to fully take of the makeup and and the balm itself LOL it's not very user friendly  I prefer my cleansers to a have a lather of some sort and this just looks like smudged  mascara. It's hydrating and doesn't leave a lil residue which is good but I feel this would work better if there was no pigment. There's no smell at all and it's very hard to take out the jar especially if u wear fake nails. Ultimately this would be a decent product if it wasn't pigmented!
faceoff_negative.headline: It's okay

rollup.name: Take The Day Off Charcoal Cleansing Balm Makeup Remover
